Pre-Game Insights: The match is the third-place game in the Copa América 2024 tournament.
Canada aims to leave a lasting impression ahead of the 2026 World Cup.
Uruguay, ranked 14th in the world, is motivated after losing to Colombia in the semifinals.
Canada's head coach Jesse Marsch may field younger players like Luc de Fougerolles in this match.
Post-Match Reflections: A win could be a memorable moment for Canada, analogous to the women's team's past successes.
The match provides an opportunity to rebuild confidence and test against a top opponent.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match has historical significance for Canada, drawing parallels to past bronze medal wins.
Canada's performance could boost their national pride and profile.
Others: The match is held at Bank of America Stadium in Charlotte, North Carolina.
Match officials include referee Alexis Herrera and VAR Derlis López.
